content.body: i think the Array.of behavior is ideal - it’s always Array unless you’re subclassing or doing something unreasonable, including when destructured. Sticking to purity is how you get the Promise statics, which break when you do the idiomatic thing and destructure them.

the Array behavior seems kind of odd because it's not actually helpful for a subclass - if the subclass is relying on `Subclass.of(x)` working, then it probably also expects `[x].map(Subclass.of)` to work, not to make a base Array

content.body: so if you're subclassing you're gonna have to override anyway

content.body: at which point, why bother looking at the receiver at all?
